column4: i know ubuntu 5.1 isnt supported where is the best place to look for help?
breezy?  you need to upgrade to a current version
how old is the machine?
you may be better off with xubuntu or lubuntu
xubuntu and lubuntu are made for older systems

a cd upgrade is going to be the least downloading... "dpkg --get-selections > packages"  on the original, then on thhe new install "dpkg --set-selections < packages"   and then "sudo apt-get dselect-upgrade"   thatll automatically reinstall everything you had installed before
http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/xubuntu i think
youll need to reinstall dependencies if you install from cd, but it should figure out dependencies for you when you tell it to install zsnes
oh then yes you need to download them. have you heard of AptOnCD?
packages.ubuntu.com lists the dependencies for all packages
nubuntu? never heard of it
xubuntu traditionally though lubuntu is the new version and a bit lighter weight
by "new version" i mean its a new not-yet-official derivative
packages.ubuntu.com is really the easiest site because it lists the dependencies and links to their download pages
packages.ubuntu.com
yes, lucid is 10.04
AptOnCD lets you make a repo on a cd. there are also companies that sell sets of the entire repositories on like 5 DVDs
you can download them from http://packages.ubuntu.com  you're going to want the versions for lucid not for breezy
many of the dependencies will be part of a default install too, dont foret
like, youll never need to get libc6 for example. thas default installed
how are you going to see the game if you dont have a graphics card?
nes itself didnt even do that
